review:
It's not a bad tablet by any means... one of the best BUT i'm slightly annoyed that it doesn't have the features i'm so use to using. My friend got me this as a gift to try to win me over to apple products... I gave it a go but It's just not for me. I decided to stick with my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014... I love using two screens at once.

Pros: Really just the new design although I tend to have issues with the new bezel when holding it, you have no choice but to have one finger on the screen which sometimes causes issues with apps. and its smooth which is great

Cons: Not enough features, and boring. This was cool years ago but with tablets out there that allow multi screen and other amazing stuff...

I gave it a go guys, and I really wanted to not be bias in my review. Hopefully you were able to see that. I think if you like the other Ipad's you will be happy with this for sure. If you want a much more amazing experience then i'd say go with the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 or even a surface tablet.

Don't believe all the reviews out there saying the ipad Air is the better tablet. Those reviews are biased and only bring up the minor upgrades from the old ipad and base the comparisons off of those few things. And the only two really bad things they had to say about the ipad Air was that it didn't have a fingerprint scanner and it didn't come in gold. The 80's called and they want their gaudy flashy gold bling back.

Most of these reviews will only focus on those points and will not mention all the other advantages the Surface 2 has. And for the few reviews that do mention the other features the Surface 2 has, they still favor the ipad because the camera was nicer or more apps. Really?

I will use the Surface 2 as comparison because it will show how ridiculous the bias is regardless of capabilities.

What the reviews usually leave out or down play.

Surface 2

1. Full office software. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote.
2. Wide screen optimized for wide screen movies. When held in portrait when you are surfing the web for example, you get a a longer list so you don't scroll as much.
3. Sd slot. Easy to download or upload data on the fly.
4. 3.0 USB so you can easily backup files to a hard drive and not have all your eggs in one basket. Or transfer files with anything that has a USB plug and also charge your phone. Ipad? No, unless you have the adapter and you can't charge your phone.
5. Can print to almost every printer.
6. Hdmi port
7. Flash support so you are not limited browsing the web.
8. Built in two position kickstand.
9. Thin keyboards that double as covers. Can get them background lit, flat, with real keys, and a new one coming out with
 built in battery to recharge your Surface at the same time on a charge. Battery in tablet is good already though. Some say that you need to buy a keyboard to make full use of the Surface and adds to the cost. Ridiculous. You do not. It will make life more easier though if you are working on a spreadsheet or word document. With an ipad you don't need one because what use would it be for? Sure there are apps. but they are limited to what you can create or edit. You have to do major creating and editing on a computer first and then hook up the ipad and transfer it.
10. Hook up to your t.v. or another monitor and drag an open window to the second screen.
11. Do a split screen on the tablet.
12. Run multiple tasks at the same time in the background like listening to music, watching a video and doing something
 else like typing an email or working on an a office document in split screen mode.
13. Wirelessly sync with your xbox and play games on your t.v, stream videos, pictures, etc.
14. Drag and drop files.
15. Can set up individual separate accounts on the tablet and have parental monitoring updates and deciding what child can do on the tablet.

Now these are not all the Surface 2 offers. I am finding new things still.

The ipad Air is basically the same ipad as before with minor tweaks. It's faster and lighter. Still does the same thing as before, nothing new.

ipad Air

1. Powerful processor. For doing nothing new. Future fingerprint scanner? Tablet will still only run apps. as before.
2. Lighter and thinner is negated by the cases to protect the ipad and without a keyboard.
3. Upgraded camera. Put it down, your annoying the people behind your trying to see the wedding or play. Use a real camera.
4. No USB or sd slot. Need adapters for just about everything. And with the Surface 2 you can plug the unit in when it is dead and keep on using it and still do things via the sd card or usb cables. On an ipad you can't do both. You either charge it or plug in an adapter to the only port the ipad has do to something. And if it is dead, you have to wait until you charge it first. Also you need to bring all the adapters and keyboard with you vs the Surface 2 of which all you need is the power cable. And the cover/keyboard is so thin it is negligible in bulk and weight. And justifying that the ipad has third party keyboards is not valid. It is a separate bulky keyboard and the ipad does not support mouse functions. You are stuck with third party hardware that is Apple specific whereas with the Surface you can use anything that supports micro SD or USB. And having to buy all these accessories tofor the ipad.will not be cheap. People gripe about the Suface cover/keyboard costs too much. Well to buy a seperate cover for an ipad will cost $40.00 and it will flop around and a non intergrated keypad will cost $100.00 that you have to carry seperatley.
5. Having to convert simple files with Apple software a hassle.
5. Tons of apps. Android not far behind. And Microsoft growing. How much apps. does one need?
6. What good is the Reina display if it isn't widescreen? Picture is actually smaller than 9.7 with the black bars.
7. Only compatible with Apple products i.e. cant print unless it is an AirPrint printer or stream to t.v. unless Apple t.v.
8. Slightly upgraded camera. Put it away! Your blocking my view! And people with a 4.8 inch phone look ridiculous? At least they are not carrying around the perfect sized iphone for one handed operation along with a 9.6 tablet that takes two hands. Kind of contradicting.

The ipad Air has more negatives than positives, so how can it be better? Android tablets have more features even than the ipads. I guess if you want one just for games and apps, then an ipad or a higher end Android tablet might suit your needs. People are not weighing in that the Surface 2 can do more than just play games.

Now back to the Surface 2. There was a slight learning curve to understand what all the gestures do. It didn't take long though. Look it up on youtube and you will pick it up real quick along with a lot of tips and tricks of what it is capable of. There different ways to open, close, move, split screen, multitask, etc.

The tablet feels a little heavy in the hand if you had to hold it I admit. But the two position kickstand works pretty good on the lap as I didn't think it would. I don't have to have a cover to add to the bulk to double as a kickstand also. And even if I put on one of the super thin keyboards they would add very little weight or bulk and they snap on and off without any hassle.

The boot up time takes a little while when completely off, but remember it is opening real office programs. When in sleep mode it opens up quickly.

I went several days at a time of casual use and in sleep mode without charging and it still had a charge.

The tiles are nice because it is real time data so I can glance at them without opening up an app. for email, weather, etc. On Apple you have a bunch of icons and you have open it up, Android you can use widgets.

With a real browser and Flash I can use full websites rather than a mobile version. And also it is a lot easier to open multiple tabs when surfing the internet unlike some tablets where it is a pain to pop back and forth between tabs.

As I mentioned above it is nice to have the split screen because my kids can research on the web on one side and write their paper on the other side while listening to music of which they shouldn't be.

The only two cons I find on the Surface 2 so far is that the power cord is only about 58 inches long. You have to be really close to an outlet of some sort.

And the main con was that the software and backup takes up about 16 gigs so you don't have the full gigs of memory stated. So might have to get an sd card. Yes other tablets you only lose about 2 gigs, but remember they are pretty much entertainment tablets only and can't do what the Surface 2 can do.

If you are waiting for a ipad Air Pro to come out. Don't be surprised if it doesn't come with a Retina display, finger print scanner, nice camera, etc. You will have to wait for the Pro S, Pro S1, etc. to get one feature at a time and not several at once. I mean come on, cant even throw in a simple camera flash. The ipads shouldn't even be placed in the categories of tablets that can run Office software. There should be a category for Dumb Tablets that only run apps, a category for Smart Tablets for those that can run fully functioning office software and not just limited mobile versions, and Extreme Tablets for ones that can run full blown Office suites.

If your a die hard Apple fan, please back up your arguments with something valid other than ipad rocks or a childish angry comment. Because if you do, it will prove my point.

When the first iPad was released in the spring of 2010, it was accompanied by a cacophony of jokes about its name and its size. Three and a half years later, the release of the iPad Air, the fifth full-size tablet Apple has offer, has been much calmer. This is the fourth full-size iPad I have owned, beginning with the AT&T 3G model which was released in May, 2010, about a month after the first WiFi only iPads arrived. Every one of my iPads has had an AT&T cellular data.

Until this model I have purchased the largest capacity solid state drive Apple has offered. This year there is a 128GB iPad, which costs about $100 more than my 64GB model. Here is the reason I did not select the higher capacity-iCloud. Data stored on iCloud is instantly available across multiple IOS and OSX devices. With all that storage (I buy 50GBs annually) why duplicate it on a hard disk?

The iPad Air is incredibly light(about a pound) and has a slightly smaller external footprint than previous models. The retina display actually seems sharper, if such a thing is possible. It also holds a charge for even longer than before.

Beyond the physical beauty of the iPad Air is its amazing utility. As a trial lawyer I can easily access the firm's network. This means that  every file and every document is instantly at my command. In just a few years time I have learned that I no longer need to drag loads of paper files and depositions with me to court.

Over 400,000 apps are built exclusively for iPad, and well over a million iPhone apps run on my device as well. It is an incredibly powerful platform, well on its way to replacing laptops for all but the most labor intensive tasks. When I travel, I typically bring only my iPad-no laptop, no hard copy of a file.  I didn't really appreciate just how dependent I had become on the iPad until this June when a federal judge held that  I could bring  either a laptop or a tablet into the courthouse. I chose the iPad.

My weapon of choice-the iPad. This is the one tablet to buy if you are serious about using a tablet. It's pricy, but it may well be, the perfect tablet.

Absolute Top quality!

It just feels great in your hands, and even though it is extremely light, it does not feel cheap or weak.

I have had every single Ipad, and this is truly a real upgrade to past versions.

For those wondering if this hardware update is worth it over past generations, it is.

Everything is super fast! Highly recommend it!

The new ipad is super light, feels great in your hands and is the fastest yet. The loss of a half pound make a huge difference that I would not have expected and the smaller bezels make the screen feel bigger.

I've come up with a list of pros and cons for this iPad Air.

Pros -
Supports the latest iOS and will for years to come since it uses a similar processor to the one in the iPhone 5S
Has a high resolution display that is good for videos and gaming
Has the side switch for toggling silent mode or orientation lock, which was removed in newer iPad models
Has a decent camera for taking pictures and videos
Supports picture in a picture
Syncs with other iOS devices you have seamlessly
Is lightweight and has great quality/build
Has quality apps in App Store

Cons-
Battery life is not the best
Lacks Touch ID
Speakers cause the iPad to vibrate when turned up too loud
Not the fastest processor

It's a good tablet that is reasonably priced and basically has all of the features the iPad Air 2 has except for split screen multitasking, Touch ID, and the A8X processor (which, in the future will mean worse performance on graphically intensive apps). Good solution for someone that doesn't mind not having all the modern amenities iOS offers while still having a snappy and reliable tablet at a decent price.

I have found my iPad Air to be useful for so many different reasons. As a college student, the size and weight have made it very convenient for me to carry to class, and the 10 hour battery life allows me to use it all day without worries. The app store is another amenity that I really enjoy, offering over one and a half million apps, it provides almost anything you could want. With sixteen gigabits of space, I have been able to download several different apps for a variety of different things without coming close to my maximum space.

Being a college student with a heavy lap top that has a short battery life, I was tired of lugging mine around everywhere I went. My iPad has allowed me to access the internet for class notes and slides at a fraction of the size. The long lasting battery has made it so I can get through a whole day of classes without needing a charger or dealing with the hassle of finding an open outlet. When the school day is over, I can kick back on the couch and comfortably hold my iPad in my lap as I catch up on everything such as sports and news.

I have found that the app store offers just about everything I want for my iPad. I have utilized several different genres of apps including games, news, sports and school. Unfortunately there are a few apps that aren't compatible with some of my homework assignments, so I have to use my laptop in these cases. Even though it isn't too big of an inconvenience, it would be nice if I could use my iPad for all of my school work. On the other hand, I have utilized several apps that are compatible with my school work such as good notes and quizlet. These apps have allowed me to make note cards with ease, as well as open my teachers slides and easily take notes on the app that I can look back on when Im studying.

On top of the several apps I have found to help enhance my school work, I have several other apps that take up a lot of space. The sixteen gigabits of space available has enabled me to follow my favorite sports teams and television addictions. I have multiple apps regarding sports such as a simple score app and others that offer live sporting games like watchESPN. I also have apps for Netflix, HBO, and almost every T.V. network that allows live streaming of shows and I have never come close to using my maximum space available.

I absolutely love my iPad and have used it every day since I purchased it! I highly recommend the iPad for people of all ages; everyone can find something of interest on the iPad to enhance their day-to-day activities or simply for personal enjoyment. I have been able to use it for both and don't know what I would do without it!

1 year after I purchased this and left a pretty good review...my iPad has completely stopped working and won't even turn on.  The retailer that sold it through amazon has been no help.  So I reached out to Apple to check the serial number.  They indicated that they had history of it being sold to an individual, and not the retailer that sold it to me through amazon. ***Written by Elizabeth Mata (701)***

Intro:
Are you looking for the perfect gift for a friend or family member? I suggest you get the iPad Air. It brings fun to kids, teens, and adults everywhere around the world!

Design:
The iPad Air comes in many different colors. Its packaged in a high quality box that is much more appealing than regular cardboard. The iPad Air already comes with a home and lock screen background, but you can change it if you want. The iPad Air is like any iPhone, but it is much more convenient if you need to type, play games, or watch videos on a bigger screen. Some people might say the iPad Air is also like a regular iPad, but its not because the iPad Air is lighter and thinner than a regular iPad. I only have one criticism of the design of the iPad Airs box: the iPad Air might be too bulky and heavy if you travel with it in its original packaging. I recommend buying a thinner case.

Apps:
The iPad Air already comes with apps such as Calculator, FaceTime, Messages, Weather, etc. You have to download certain apps by yourself (such as games). If you're a student youll need to download apps like Microsoft Word to type. A problem with some of the apps is that they either glitch or lag. Sometimes they can mess up your iPad. Also, some of the apps can take up too much space and using the apps might make your iPad work slower.

Camera:
The iPad Air comes with a camera to take pictures, videos, and selfies. The camera works very well with FaceTime. The camera on the iPhone is the same as the iPad Air, meaning that it takes better pictures and videos than a Samsung phone/tablet. One problem about taking pictures and videos is that if you take too many, you will run out of space on your iPad Air.

Colors:
The iPad Air comes in five different colors: red, black, white, silver, and space grey. These different colors are helpful when you're in a rush and you don't want to accidentally grab someone elses iPad. These different colors will most likely help those of you who have busy schedules. A problem with the colors is that people might want their iPad Air in blue, green, or pink. People who want different colors might become tired of the same five colors.

Conclusion:
The iPad Air is perfect for Apple product lovers, gamers, and students. Even though there might be some problems with the iPad Air (such as the apps lagging/glitching), its still a good product. You might have to pay extra depending on how many gigabytes you want for storage space. Dont forget that an iPad Air is light and thin so it won't be as heavy and as thick as a regular iPad. If you love Apple products, travel around as a student, or love playing games, the iPad Air is for you!

How deceptive can a seller be? Decptive enough to place refurbished ipads in new boxes that come "looking" like their factory sealed but sadly their not even new. First red flag for me was the serial number on the box that the ipad came in did not match the serial number that is displayed under Settings>General>About. This is where all the "real" information about the ipad is located folks. After noticing the serial number did not match i then noticed the model of the ipad was not correct either. The ipad model in the Amazon listing of this seller claims this model is MD789LL/A, in fact it is NOT under the About section located under the settings of the ipad my model number is FF529LL/B which is classified REFURBISHED, i was told this after contacting Apple. In addition the responsiveness of the touch screen is pretty disappointing on this ipad as well; maybe that has something to do with the fact that its refurbished crap. This being my third ipad and all I'm kind of familiar with the quality of Apple products. If you plan on purchasing from this seller i would proceed with extreme caution and check the serial number as well as the model number not the ones located on the box but the "real" information stored inside the ipad (Settings>General>About is where you can find that information). Then verify the model number and serial number by contacting Apple to see if you have a "new" ipad as this seller is FALSELY ADVERTISING! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SELLER TO ANYONE!!!

I've always bought Apple products with as little storage as possible, simply because I have a hard time justifying an $80 to $100 increase in price just for more space. I feel like if you are going to spend an extra $80 to $100, you should also get more with the product. Maybe it would be a little slimmer, maybe it would be a little faster. I just have issue with the large cost increase for just extra storage. With that said, I'm happy with the product that I have, but do wish that I had gotten the larger size. I say that I wish that I had gotten the larger size, but would not have actually purchased the larger size.

For ~$350, you're getting a great device that will allow you do a multitude of things. This device fits great in your hand and looks amazing, no matter what you are doing. The screen is absolutely phenomenal and it is a really great device. I found that my children actually used this more than I did, but that everyone in the family had some sort of fun on it. Whether it be streaming a movie or show (kids), shopping (my wife), or just enjoying all that the device has to offer (me), there is something for everyone to enjoy with an iPad.

I know that I'm late to review it, but if you are looking for an iPad right now and are contemplating one of the newer versions versus this one, I would say that it all depends on what you want out of it. If you need the newest and greatest, obviously get the iPad Air 2 (or whatever version is available at the time of reading this review). If you are happy with a device that may not be as fast as the newest one and you are on a budget, this is a great option for you.

Even after the honeymoon phase of owning a new device, I still found myself reaching for it over my phone or my computer when I needed to look something up or just wanted to relax for a bit.

My wifes IPAD3 bit the dust, while parts were VERY cheap I decided to surprise her with this refurbished unit, IMHO iPads are a lot like used cars, why pay full price for something with will be worth a fraction once you open the box. upon receiving she was very pleased with the IPAD air, of course I could have purchased a refurbished unit from Apple for almost 200 more, but with the cost of parts being pennies on the $ the only thing I would have received would have been a 1 year warranty that most likely would have gone unused. Being that the mother board for an apple 128gb IPAD air isn't even $200 this was a much better route and considering she was very pleased with the condition and functionality of the unit she received that proved this was a good decision. Great purchase, happy wife, happy me.

Love my new ipad!!  I've always been an Android guy but have always been curious on the ipads. I have an expensive Android tablet,  but decided to see what the big fuss is all about. So,  I decided order me an ipad and came across the ipadvair and decided to order. SO glad I did!!  Love my new Apple. Its so then and light and love the screen on this tablet. My android tablet has a full HD screen but I honestly can't tell the difference. Apples software just seems to flow and run so smoother than my Android,  I can definitely see why so many people have Apple ipads!! The speakers on it are just as loud and sound just as good other tablet with Dolby sound built in. I actually haven't used my other Android tablet since I got my new Apple!  I highly recommend anyone to try an Apple,  and you to will love yours!!

****UPDATE*** 08/09/15********
Beware, I thought I was purchasing a BRAND NEW unit and come to find out I was sold a refurbished or previously activated unit. My charger quit working after only 4 months, contacted Apple Tech Support for warranty exchange, and only to come to find out my warranty had already expired!!! WHAT???? Yup, the unit was previously activated and or refurbished at least a year prior to me getting it which means my BRAND new unit that I thought was new had no warranty at all and I would have to pay an additional $20 for a new charger at a Apple Store. Luckily, Amazon stepped up and is letting me return the unit for a full refund. THANK  YOU Amazon, you guys are great!! But, please beware as you can see from other people on here that are getting used units from these sellers.

If you like tablets, you might consider the iPad Air. It has a 9.7 inch display, an A7 processor, and an M7 coprocessor. It comes with iOS 7. Then for my favorite part of the iPad Air, which is that you can use it as a personal hotspot for your other devices. For example, let's say your on vacation in a hotel in Washington D.C., but it doesn't it have Wi-Fi. No problem! Just set up the iPad hotdog on your phone and voila! The iPad Air is much thinner than its predecessors, with a 7.5 millimeter edge. It has a 5 Megapixel camera, which is the same as the other iPads. The only thing that I can criticize about the Air is that it lacks Slo-Mo video AND filters, and even the 5c has those, and the 5c is hardly as powerful as the tablet. I hope you enjoyed, and I also hope that Apple goes on to make more powerful tablets.
